question.para: Which packages are required in Linux to use Adagio?

answer.para: Adagio is installed using the version control system git. The minimum set of packages to install and use Adagio are:

listitem.para: git-core: The version control system GIT used to download, install and upgrade Adagio.
python: the interpreter and libraries (any version older than 3.0).
python-lxml: Python bindings for libxml2 and libxslt libraries.
python-libxml2: Python bindings for the GNOME XML library (needed by python-lxml and therefore installed automatically as a dependency when installing python-lxml).
docbook-xsl: XSL stylesheets to process DocBook documents

answer.para: Use the software management application included in your Linux distribution to install these packages (the names are as they appear in the software repositories).
